name: HD 190360
scenarioDescription:
The HD 190360 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 190360 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.14 times its radius. It is located 52.22 light years away from the solar system.

HD 190360 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 190360 system


HD 190360 b

HD 190360 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.97 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 190360 b is 489.72 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 190360 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 190360 c

HD 190360 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 190360 c is 19.08 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 190360 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 190360, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Haute-Provence Observatory.
